sen.j: 東宮傅（とうぐうのふ）は、律令制に定められた皇太子（東宮）付きの教育官の一つである。
sen.e: Togu-no-fu was a kind of educational officer that worked for the Togu (Crown Prince) as stipulated in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 皇太子に道徳を説いて輔導する常設官である。
sen.e: Togu-no-fu was a standing official that taught the Crown Prince morality and gave him guidance.

sen.j: 定員一名で官位は従四位上相当で貴族が兼ねることが多い。
sen.e: Only one person at a time could become Togu-no-fu, and Togu-no-fu was often an aristcrat with an official court rank of Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 唐の太子三師を模倣したものである。
sen.e: This Togu-no-fu position was modeled after Taishisanshi of the Tang Dynasty.

sen.j: 東宮において太政大臣に相当するが皇太子の家政を担当する春宮坊や東宮学士とは独立の関係にあり指揮権限はないに等しい。
sen.e: Togu-no-fu was the Grand Minister at Togu's palace and was independent of Togubo (Crown Prince's quarters) members, who were in charge of the domestic economy of the palace, or Togu gakushi (Crown Prince's classics teacher); therefore, he did not have any delegatory authority.

sen.j: 東宮学士同様､下部機構も上部機構も持たないため式部省が勤務評定を行う。
sen.e: Just as was the case with Togu gakushi, Togu-no-fu also did not have any subordinate or upper organization; therefore, Shikibu-sho (Ministry of the Ceremonial) assessed the service level of Togu-no-fu.

sen.e: From the middle of the Heian period, Togu gakushi and Togu-no-fu were collectively called Togu-shiki (the Board of the Crown Prince's Affairs) as contrasted to Togubo.
